text: Philippe Pottier (9 July 1938 – 22 September 1985) was a Swiss footballer. He played as a midfielder. He played for club sides La Chaux-de-Fonds, Stade Français, Angers, Servette and Étoile Carouge. He played 16 games for the national team. He played for Switzerland at the 1962 FIFA World Cup. He was born in Monthey. Pottier died on 22 September 1985, at the age of 47. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1938 births Category:1985 deaths Category:1962 FIFA World Cup players Category:Swiss footballers Category:People from Valais
title: Philippe Pottier
